clinical_study.brief_title: An Ascending Multiple Dose Study of CD101 IV in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomized, Double-Blind, Multiple-Dose, Dose-Escalation Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of CD101 Injection in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: A multiple ascending dose study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of CD101 Injection in Healthy Subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase 1, single-center, prospective, randomized, double-blind study of multiple ascending doses (MAD) of CD101 Injection administered IV to healthy adult subjects. In this study, subjects in 3 cohorts of 8 subjects each will be randomized to receive multiple IV doses of CD101 Injection or placebo infusions. Dose levels of CD101 Injection to be assessed will follow an ascending multiple-dose regimen.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety as assessed by the number of subjects with clinically significant adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with clinically significant adverse events (AEs)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach peak plasma concentration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration time curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: The volume of plasma cleared of the drug per unit time (CL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume in which the drug is distributed (Vz)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate at which a drug is removed from the body (^z),
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug
Up to 2 weeks following last dose of study drug

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men must be surgically sterilized or using contraception,
- No significant findings on physical exam, ECG, clinical laboratory tests,
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 and 32.0 kg/m2, inclusive
- Must provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Females of child bearing potential
- Signs and or symptoms of acute illness or chronic disease
- Use of prescription medications within 28 days
- Use of OTC, supplements, and herbals within 14 days
- Current smoker
- Previous participation in a clinical study within 28 days
